prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A man is being questioned by authorities following a young child's cardiac arrest at a local amusement park. The child, estimated to be around six months old, was rushed to the hospital in critical condition after the incident, which occurred on a Ferris wheel at the park around 3 pm on Friday.

The man, a 35-year-old resident of the neighboring town, was arrested on suspicion of child neglect and endangerment. He has been released on bail and is expected to appear in court next month.

The amusement park released a statement expressing their deep concern for the child's well-being and offering support to the family. They also mentioned that their trained medical staff had provided immediate care to the child until emergency services arrived.

Thames Valley Police are urging anyone with information about the incident, particularly those who were in the vicinity of the Ferris wheel at the time of the incident, to come forward and speak with the authorities. They emphasize the importance of avoiding speculation and respecting the privacy of the family during this difficult time.

At this time, the police are not seeking any further suspects in relation to the incident. The investigation is ongoing, and updates will be provided as more information becomes available.

A woman is brought in for questioning by the police after a small child collapses at a community fair. The child, thought to be around a year and a half, was taken to the hospital in serious condition following the incident, which took place on a carousel at the fair around 5 pm on Saturday.

The woman, a 42-year-old resident of the nearby city, was taken into custody on suspicion of child neglect and endangerment. She has been released on bail and is set to appear in court in a few weeks.

The fair released a statement expressing their deep concern for the child's health and offering support to the family. They also mentioned that their trained medical personnel had given immediate care to the child until emergency medical services arrived.

Greater Manchester Police are asking anyone with information about the incident, especially those who were near the carousel at the time of the incident, to come forward and speak with the authorities. They stress the importance of refraining from speculation and respecting the privacy of the family during this trying time.

At the moment, the police are not looking for any additional suspects in connection with the incident. The investigation is ongoing, and updates will be provided as more information becomes available.

A man is brought in for questioning by the local authorities after a toddler suddenly falls unconscious during a town festival. The incident occurred on a ferris wheel at the festival around 4 pm on a sunny Sunday.

The man, a 35-year-old local, was taken into custody on suspicion of neglect and endangerment of a minor. He has been released on bail and is scheduled to appear in court in a month.

The festival organizers released a statement expressing their deep concern for the child's well-being and offering support to the family. They stated that their trained medical staff provided immediate care to the toddler until emergency medical services arrived.

The authorities are urging anyone with information about the incident, particularly those who were close to the ferris wheel at the time, to come forward and speak with the investigators. They emphasize the importance of avoiding speculation and respecting the privacy of the family during this difficult period.

Currently, the police are not searching for any further suspects in relation to the incident. The investigation is ongoing and updates will be provided as more details become available.

A woman is sought for questioning by the local police following a young child getting injured during a local carnival. The incident happened on a roller coaster at the event, around 5 pm on a busy Saturday.

The woman, a 40-year-old local, was taken into custody on suspicion of negligence and endangerment of a minor. She is still being held and is expected to appear in court in the coming days.

The carnival organizers released a statement expressing their deep concern for the child's well-being and offering support to the family. They stated that their trained medical staff provided immediate care to the child until emergency medical services arrived.

The police are urging anyone with information about the incident, particularly those who were close to the roller coaster at the time, to come forward and speak with the investigators. They emphasize the importance of avoiding speculation and respecting the privacy of the family during this difficult period.

Currently, the police are not searching for any further suspects in relation to the incident. The investigation is ongoing and updates will be provided as more details become available. The authorities hope that the quick actions of the medical staff and the cooperation of any witnesses will help shed light on what happened and ensure the safety of all attendees in the future.
